titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that China should purchase a majority of its imported wheat from the United States in order to reduce the trade imbalance between China and the United States.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Finance.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S5795-5796)

bill.summary: 5/11/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should insist that China purchase a majority of its wheat imports from the United States in order to reduce its trade imbalance with the United States.
